title: Why new 'Priv' phone might save BlackBerry’s handset business (but probably won’t)
text: BlackBerry’s recently announced "Priv" slider phone is a bit of an enigma. One the one hand, it appears to be a solid Android device with some innovative touches (capacitive keyboard) and a decent spec sheet. On the other hand, it comes bundled with a grab bag of features (BBM, BlackBerry Hub) that seem to have been lifted straight out of the company’s much maligned BB10 OS, in some cases without thought for how (or even if) they will integrate with Google’s user environment .
